Package Game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board is the class which represents the Pentago game board. The board is represented by an array of Marks. The class provides lots of fundamental methods to play the game. The client and server, strategy and the players all need methods from this class.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Daan Schram, Denis Krylov

    • Method Detail

      • deepCopy

        public Board deepCopy()
        Creates a copy of the board. The copy should contain the same position on the board as the original one.
        Returns:
        copy of the board. If the board is empty, returns an empty copy of the board

      • index

        public int index​(int row,
                 int col)
        Calculates the index of the board from a (row, col) pair.
        Parameters:
        row - row of the board
        col - column of the board
        Returns:
        the index belonging to the (row,col)-field

      • isField

        public boolean isField​(int index)
        Returns true if index is a valid index of a field on the board.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the board
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= index < DIM * DIM

      • isField

        public boolean isField​(int row,
                       int col)
        Returns true of the (row,col) pair refers to a valid field on the board.
        Parameters:
        col - column of board
        row - row of board
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= row < DIM && 0 <= col < DIM

        public Mark getField​(int i)
        Returns current mark of the selected field.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the mark on the field

      • isEmptyField

        public boolean isEmptyField​(int row,
                            int col)

        Parameters:

        col - the column of the field
        Returns:
        true if the field is empty

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Checks if the board is full. When the board full there is no empty space on it.
        Returns:
        true if all fields are occupied

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        Checks if the game over. The game is over when there is a winner or the whole board is full.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over

      • hasRow

        public boolean hasRow​(Mark m,
                      int streak)
        Checks if there is a row that contains a selected number of marks in succession.
        Parameters:
        m - selected mark
        streak - the amount of marks that are the same in succession
        Returns:
        true if there is a column that contains more than a selected number of marks in succession
        See Also:
        Mark

        Returns:
        true if there is a diagonal contains more than 4 selected marks in succession
        See Also:
        Mark

      • isWinner

        public boolean isWinner​(Mark m)
        Checks if the selected mark has won. Player wins if player has more than 4 marks on at least one row, column or diagonal.
        Parameters:
        m - selected mark
        Returns:
        true if the selected mark has won
        See Also:
        Mark

      • hasWinner

        public boolean hasWinner()
        Checks if the game has a winner. The game has a winner if one of two players has more than 4 marks on at least one row, column or diagonal.
        Returns:
        true if the winner exists, false if there is a tie

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Shows the board as a String. On the left side shows the current state of the board. On the right side shows numbering of the fields.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the board as a String

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Empties all fields on the board.

      • setField

        public void setField​(int i,
                     Mark m)
        Puts the selected mark on the selected field on the board.
        Parameters:
        i - the field number (see NUMBERING)
        m - the mark to be placed

                     int col,
                     Mark m)

        Parameters:
        row - the row of the field
        col - the column of the field
        m - selected mark
        See Also:
        Mark

      • rotate

        public void rotate​(int choice)
        Changes indexes of the marks on the board. This method take choice as the following: choice = 0 : rotate the top left sub-board counter-clockwise, choice = 1 : rotate the top left sub-board clockwise, choice = 2 : rotate the top right sub-board counter-clockwise, choice = 3 : rotate the top right sub-board clockwise, choice = 4 : rotate the bottom left sub-board counter-clockwise, choice = 5 : rotate the bottom left sub-board clockwise, choice = 6 : rotate the bottom right sub-board counter-clockwise, choice = 7 : rotate the bottom right sub-board clockwise. Example: if the mark on the index 2 that means it's located on the top-left sub-board. If 0 has chosen, index would change to 0. If 1 has chosen, index would change to 14. If other indexed have chosen, the index would stay the same.
        Parameters:
        choice - index at which the sub-board starts

      • rotateBack

        public void rotateBack​(int choice)
        Does the opposite of rotate function
        Parameters:
        choice - index at which the sub-board starts
        See Also:
        rotate(int)

      • rotateClockWise

        private Mark[] rotateClockWise​(Mark[] copyList,
                               int index)
        Rotates chosen by index sub-board clockwise.
        Parameters:
        copyList - copy of the current board
        index - index at which sub-board starts
        Returns:
        the new list in which the sub-board is rotated
        See Also:
        Mark

        See Also:
